opendial.bn.distribs.incremental

Class IncrementalDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.incremental.IncrementalDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiscreteDistribution, IndependentProbDistribution, ProbDistribution

    public class IncrementalDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndependentProbDistribution, DiscreteDistribution
    Representation of an incremental distribution -- that is, an distribution that is built up of a connected graph of smaller units that can be incrementally inserted or modified at runtime.

    The incremental distribution is therefore composed of a set of IncrementalUnit objects connected with one another (where each connection is associated with a particular probability). The values of the distribution correspond to the possible "paths" through the graph, starting from units without any predecessors and ending with units without any successors. The probability of each path is defined as the product of the probabilities for each connection traversed by the path.

    The incremental distribution can be explicitly marked as "committed", which means that its content will not change anymore.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-04-16 17:34:31 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the distribution is well-formed, and false otherwise. The distribution is well-formed if:
        • it contains no cycles
        • AND that the sum of probabilities for the connections leaving from a particular unit are <= 1.0.
        Specified by:
        isWellFormed in interface ProbDistribution
        Returns:
        true if well-formed, false otherwise
